channel.title: Animated armors not dropping items
channel.description: So, I added in warrior's guild everything is working perfectly, but as for the animated armor guys they don't drop anything I even tried adding drops for them inside of config.java but still nothing. The only thing they do drop is coins and bones i searched there id but nothing shows up.

item.title: Animated armors not dropping items
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“tank nation, post:4, topic:554640”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=673565.msg4503746#msg4503746 date=1454623584]
Don’t use your drop system to add their drops.
Add in code to where the death handler is for the npcs.
The reason I say not to use your drop system is because they actually aren’t supposed to have any drops… Not even bones (It’s animated armour… how would it have a skeletal system?).
Another reason why is because there’s also supposed to be a chance you lose a part, or all of, the armour you used in the animator.

(A poor) Example:

if(npcs[i].npcType == animated_amour_id) { Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(the_player, armour_id, etc, etc...); }
[/quote]

This is what I do have but it’s still not dropping anything besides them bones and coins.

int[] animatedArmor = {2450, 2451, 2452, 2453, 2454, 2455, 2456}; int[] tokens = {10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70}; for(int f = 0; f < animatedArmor.length; f++) { if (npcs[i].npcType == animatedArmor[f]) { Server.getWarriorsGuild().setSpawned(c, true); Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(c, 8851, npcs[i].absX, npcs[i].absY, tokens[f], c.playerId); } }[/quote]
Do me a favor. Place this line inside the if statement:
Place this line:

Compile, run, and go kill an animated armour.

Tell me if it prints out into the console or not.

P.S: This is called debugging. (Something you should do as soon as you encounter an issue like this)

Read full topic

item.title: Animated armors not dropping items
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:554640”]Don’t use your drop system to add their drops.
Add in code to where the death handler is for the npcs.
The reason I say not to use your drop system is because they actually aren’t supposed to have any drops… Not even bones (It’s animated armour… how would it have a skeletal system?).
Another reason why is because there’s also supposed to be a chance you lose a part, or all of, the armour you used in the animator.

(A poor) Example:

if(npcs[i].npcType == animated_amour_id) { Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(the_player, armour_id, etc, etc...); }[/quote]

This is what I do have but it’s still not dropping anything besides them bones and coins.

int[] animatedArmor = {2450, 2451, 2452, 2453, 2454, 2455, 2456}; int[] tokens = {10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70}; for(int f = 0; f < animatedArmor.length; f++) { if (npcs[i].npcType == animatedArmor[f]) { Server.getWarriorsGuild().setSpawned(c, true); Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(c, 8851, npcs[i].absX, npcs[i].absY, tokens[f], c.playerId); } }

Don’t use your drop system to add their drops.
Add in code to where the death handler is for the npcs.
The reason I say not to use your drop system is because they actually aren’t supposed to have any drops… Not even bones (It’s animated armour… how would it have a skeletal system?).
Another reason why is because there’s also supposed to be a chance you lose a part, or all of, the armour you used in the animator.

(A poor) Example:

if(npcs[i].npcType == animated_amour_id) { Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(the_player, armour_id, etc, etc...); }

item.title: Animated armors not dropping items
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Could be a few things.

In the standard server, npc drops and constant drops are handled in different files. So make sure you’re checking both. Also make sure you have the correct id for the armours, or of course they won’t drop any items.

The “bones and coins” could be a default drop in your server for something that isn’t defined.

Make sure that there is no exception being thrown when dropping the item, this can cause no drops.

The ids that I used were 4278-4284

Read full topic
